result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devonta J Lewis

defendant.name: Lewis, Devonta J
defendant.address: 97 Arlington Ave W, St Paul, MN 55117

records.addlTxt: Motion hearing on November 29, 2022 at 10:30 am.

(Case called at 9:59 AM) Defendant Devonta J Lewis in court, in custody with Attorney Zebulon Patek. District Attorney Peter Rindal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense enters Not Guilty pleas on all counts. Court receives Not Guilty pleas. Defense indicates motions are forthcoming and requests a Motion Hearing to be scheduled. State requests 30 days for any written response to the motion and a due date for the motion by Defense.  
Court orders Motion by Defense to be filed by October 28 and any written response by State before the Motion Hearing. 
Motion Hearing: 11/29/2022 at 10:30 AM (set for 1 hour).
Notice of Assignment of Judge - Return to Sender, Not Deliverable as Addressed, Unable to Forward

(3:06 PM case called.) All parties and court personnel appear via Zoom. 
Defendant Devonta J Lewis in court, in custody. Attorney Zebulon Patek in court for Devonta J Lewis. Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waives right to a personal appearance and wants to proceed. Court accepts the defendant's waiver to a personal appearance.
State calls Investigator Aaron Ranallo of the Eau Claire County Sheriff's Department, who is sworn and testifies.
Attorney Patek conducts cross-examination of Investigator Ranallo. Witness excused.
State moves for bind over.
Attorney Patek has no argument regarding bind over.
Court finds probable cause and binds the case over.
Attorney Patek to schedule an Arraignment with Branch 6 Judicial Assistant.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
(11:03 AM case called.) Defendant Devonta J Lewis appeared by video, in custody in the Eau Claire County Jail. Attorney Sonia L Anderson appeared by video for Devonta J Lewis. Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant acknowledges receipt of the complaint.
Defendant is eligible for Public Defender representation.
Defendant updates phone number with the Court.
State requests $10,000.00 cash bond and cites reasoning. Attorney Anderson requests signature bond or low cash bond and cites reasoning.
Court orders $5,000.00 cash bond with conditions.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Conditions:
No contact with T.G., A.D.
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.
